SENT.plain: A sixty-year old patient had inferior nasal visual field defect in both eyes associated with papilledema
After pseudotumor cerebri was diagnosed and the appropriate treatment begun, the papilledema disappeared, but the visual field defect persisted

This case suggests a revision of the classical concepts concerning the pathogenesis of binasal defects from intracranial causes and emphasizes the risk of loss of vision inherent in long-standing papilledema
